name: Lateral connectivity for riparian fauna
functionStatement: Continuous pathways for free movement of water, sediment, and organisms supporting recolonization, maintaining species diversity, and enabling recovery.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain/wetlands accessible for semiaquatic fauna unless steep canyons preclude it.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map levees or berms along the corridor and summarize continuous barrier length. Confirm passable gaps where present.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Both banks armored or walled for long distances. Few or no access points.
Criteria: Heavily walled or leveed corridor. Minimal lateral connectivity.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Long levees or ripraped banks on one side limit access to the floodplain in many places.
Criteria: Large levees hamper movement in many areas.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Short levee segments occur, but frequent gaps allow movement to wetlands.
Criteria: Some partial barriers but still some access.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Banks are free of continuous levees or walls. Side channels and backwaters are accessible.
Criteria: No major levees or walls. Free lateral movement for semiaquatic fauna.
